keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: A proposal from Thomas Hoenig of the F.D.I.C. is meant to be a surgical and effective response to requests to reform the Dodd-Frank Act.

headline.print_headline: Rule Relief for Banks at Low Risk
headline.main: Regulatory Relief for Banks That Rarely Fail

snippet: A proposal from Thomas Hoenig of the F.D.I.C. is meant to be a surgical and effective response to requests to reform the Dodd-Frank Act.
abstract: Gretchen Morgenson Fair Game column examines proposals from Federal Deposit Insurance Corp Vice PresThomas M Hoenig that would reform Dodd-Frank rules for certain financial organizations; welcomes idea of granting exemptions to smaller banks that hold no trading assets or liabilities, a class that did not contribute to 2008 financial collapse.
